# jest/no-duplicate-hooks <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
</div>

### What it does

Disallows duplicate hooks in describe blocks.

### Why is this bad?

Having duplicate hooks in a describe block can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

### Example

Examples of **incorrect** code for this rule:

```javascript
describe("foo", () => {
  beforeEach(() => {
    // some setup
  });
  beforeEach(() => {
    // some setup
  });
  test("foo_test", () => {
    // some test
  });
});

// Nested describe scenario
describe("foo", () => {
  beforeEach(() => {
    // some setup
  });
  test("foo_test", () => {
    // some test
  });
  describe("bar", () => {
    test("bar_test", () => {
      afterAll(() => {
        // some teardown
      });
      afterAll(() => {
        // some teardown
      });
    });
  });
});
```

Examples of **correct** code for this rule:

```javascript
describe("foo", () => {
  beforeEach(() => {
    // some setup
  });
  test("foo_test", () => {
    // some test
  });
});

// Nested describe scenario
describe("foo", () => {
  beforeEach(() => {
    // some setup
  });
  test("foo_test", () => {
    // some test
  });
  describe("bar", () => {
    test("bar_test", () => {
      beforeEach(() => {
        // some setup
      });
    });
  });
});
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny jest/no-duplicate-hooks --jest-plugin
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "plugins": ["jest"],
  "rules": {
    "jest/no-duplicate-hooks": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
